title: Instead of fixing Talon's [E] bug, why not add it as a mechanic?
body:
I won't explain again what's the [E] bug because this thread already did https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/YRvUI30o-now-that-ive-been-playing-talon-again

But why not keep it as a mechanic?  it allows you to outplay champions/skillshots if used properly, I had a replay which the [E] bug allowed me to dodge {{champion:81}}'s Ulti, I'll try to find it and upload it, but it was all luck ofc, and I felt like it could be put to use.

Why not add [while the key is held down, talon will jump backwards/ will backflip] ?  this type of mechanic is already in the game [[{{champion:19}}'s Q]]  , so why not use it on Talon?

WW's Q hold out playing Flash probs shouldn't be in the game... considering how often WW players do it on accident because the kit is super strong and super easy to play. he pretty much has 2 damage skills until level 6 (the other one is a nice passive and move speed and attack speed at low hp but no real damage) and he can out damage a shit load of people early. something seems fishy about that too! WW has be receiving a lot of negative attention for his high win rate and overall extremely easy play style compare to how rewarding it is playing so safe.

I don't think you are quite getting what he means.  He means that if he holds down E, it changes what his E will do, from the flip over wall, to backflip off of the wall, similar to how Warwick can hold Q to make it follow enemies as well, or just quick release it for the quick damage and gap closer.

I was referring to how Warwick's [Q] is coded, I wasn't talking about what advantages it offers. I want Talon to have the same kind of mechanic and to be able to use the jump in a more dimensional way, rather than to having it be fixed from point A--->B
my bad i thought you were talkin about holding down the Q for lunge to make sure you can control melee q
Bring back Cutthroat.
No chance of getting that back at all. I'd rather have the old Rake [W] back if you ask me, would make Talon much more easier to play, and more satisfying.
Old Rake+ Current Passive+ Current Q would be excessively strong
Remove the crit on melee q and we call it even?

I'd love this, then his E could actually be useful in lane!

Could make for some cool looking turnarounds too.

If he's going to have the best map mobility tool outside of Quinn's ult, then there should be a drawback in that he has to commit to jumping instead of cancelling it mid hop when realizing it may not be a good idea to go in.

Fix the bug, don't let him cancel out of it.

If you're talking about live talon, he can't cancel it mid hop unless he gets cc'd, but if you're talking about the proposed bug mechanic, OP means while you're running towards the wall you can hold down the key to backflip _instead_ of going over. Like warwick Q. He doesn't mean being able to go backwards after jumping over the wall.
I know. I don't think he needs any more mobility though.
I dunno i don't think he's got any nobility at all really, since he was basically raised as a gutter rat.
Talon rework should just be reverted. He feels like shit to play, especially thanks to the E change which no one asked for.

I think the current way is that they can't control the direction the E is; sometimes it'll flip backwards and sometimes it goes forwards.
That being said, it's difficult enough to make it go in one direction, much less both.

While that E change is a buff to Talon, it's not the area that he needs buffs in. 

I'm fairly confident that Talon already has enough escape as is in-between his super short CD ult and constant (unreliable) parkouring; he doesn't need more juking.
the intent of talon is that he can jump -over- walls, giving him a vault away from walls is a whole new power level
I like it, good idea.
Thats actually a really cool effect and since you dont traverse the wall fully it could cut the CD by a part
As funny as it'd be I'd rather see wall coding fixed.
